titleStmt.title: A relation of a mans return and his travaills out of a long and sore captivitie to partake of that rest, which remaineth to the people of God. Written for the sake of those who wants the consolation of Israel, and would walke in the heavenly way thereof, if they knew it. Written by one of Zyons travellors, Th. Bayles.
titleStmt.author: Bayle, Thomas.
Crisp, Stephen, 1628-1692.

notesStmt.note: This edition has 24 pages and is signed at end: T.B. Another edition has 26 pages and is dated at end: 1677.
Includes a preface, signed: S.C., i.e. Stephen Crisp--Smith.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
